info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.
info.title: NetworkManagementClient

get.description: Lists ExpressRoute gateways under a given subscription.

parameters.description: Client API version.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

id.description: Resource ID.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

bounds.description: Minimum and maximum number of scale units to deploy.

max.description: Maximum number of scale units deployed for ExpressRoute gateway.

min.description: Minimum number of scale units deployed for ExpressRoute gateway.

expressRouteConnections.description: List of ExpressRoute connections to the ExpressRoute gateway.

id.description: Resource ID.

authorizationKey.description: Authorization key to establish the connection.

id.description: The ID of the ExpressRoute circuit peering.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

routingWeight.description: The routing weight associated to the connection.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

virtualHub.description: The Virtual Hub where the ExpressRoute gateway is or will be deployed.

id.description: The resource URI for the Virtual Hub where the ExpressRoute gateway is or will be deployed. The Virtual Hub resource and the ExpressRoute gateway resource reside in the same subscription.

get.description: Lists ExpressRoute gateways in a given resource group.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: Client API version.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

id.description: The ID of the ExpressRoute circuit peering.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

routingWeight.description: The routing weight associated to the connection.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

virtualHub.description: The Virtual Hub where the ExpressRoute gateway is or will be deployed.

id.description: The resource URI for the Virtual Hub where the ExpressRoute gateway is or will be deployed. The Virtual Hub resource and the ExpressRoute gateway resource reside in the same subscription.

delete.description: Deletes the specified ExpressRoute gateway in a resource group. An ExpressRoute gateway resource can only be deleted when there are no connection subresources.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRoute gateway.
parameters.name: expressRouteGatewayName

parameters.description: Client API version.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.
